verses.roman:
eka-dina eka-sthāne nadī pāra haite
uḍiyā nāvika kukkura nā caḍāya naukāte

synonyms: eka-dina—one day; eka-sthāne—in one place; nadī—a river; pāra—crossing; haite—to do; uḍiyā nāvika—a boatman who was an Oriyā (Orissan); kukkura—the dog; nā caḍāya—does not allow to mount; naukāte—on the boat.
translation: One day, when they needed to cross a river, an Orissan boatman would not allow the dog to get in the boat.
